content.title: Axillary Vascular Injury
content.description: Management of axillary artery and vein injuries

key_concepts.details: Penetrating trauma, blunt shoulder dislocation, iatrogenic (catheterization)
Brachial plexus injury common (20-60%); shoulder and proximal humerus fractures
Infraclavicular incision; may require pectoralis division; deltopectoral approach
Primary repair, interposition graft (GSV), prosthetic if necessary

content.clinical_significance: Brachial plexus status determines long-term functional outcome
content.statement: Axillary Vascular Injury is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Trauma that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
